author: Nicole Morley
title: Donald Trump jr used London terror attack to peddle anti-Muslim hate
text:
Donald Trump Jr has been branded a disgrace (Picture: Twitter) The POTUS’s son made no mention of the fact he’d shared an old article, allowing thousands of his followers to believe Khan’s comments were said in the aftermath of the shocking attack.
People on Twitter were quick to point out that the interview was old and completely unrelated to the March 22 attacks on London, though at time of publishing Donald Trump Jr’s tweet remains.
Thousands of people shared Trump Jr’s tweet suggesting Khan said terror attacks were to be expected (Picture: Twitter) The error was pointed out repeatedly (Picture: Twitter) It’s unclear if he was aware when posting that the Khan interview in the Independent was out of date, although more than 15 hours later it’s been highlighted repeatedly.
MP Wes Streeting replied to the post, saying: You use a terrorist attack on our city to attack London’s Mayor for your own political gain.
‘You’re a disgrace.’
Here’s what Sadiq Khan actually said after the capital was gripped by terrorism: 
‘We stand together in the face of those who seek to harm us and destroy our way of life. We always have, and we always will. Londoners will never be cowed by terrorism,’ he said.
Khan also assured Londoners there would be additional police on the streets to keep residents and tourists safe.
